Vozniki bodo že pred martinovanji pihali
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Sijan Pretnar

V tednu pred martinovanji so policisti že na cestah, začenja se akcija Slovenija piha 0,0. Trajala bo do 10. novembra in se nato nadaljevala še decembra. Policisti bodo v tem času poostreno preverjali psihofizične sposobnosti voznikov.



Včeraj se je začela preventivna akcija Slovenija piha 0,0. Foto: Ana Cukijati

LJUBLJANA > Do zadnjih dni oktobra so se na slovenskih cestah zgodile 1203 nesreče, ki so jih povzročili pijani vozniki ali drugi udeleženci, kar je sicer 0,75 odstotka manj kot leto poprej. Zaradi pijanih povzročiteljev nesreč je po podatkih agencije za varnost prometa do konca oktobra umrlo 28 ljudi, kar pa je kar 47 odstotkov več kot v enakem obdobju lanskega leta, ko je umrlo 19 ljudi. Od omenjenih 28 ljudi, ki so umrli v nesrečah, jih je 18 tudi povzročilo nesrečo.
Obalno kraška regija izstopa po nesrečah, povezanih z alkoholom
Največ nesreč s smrtnim izidom so povzročili vozniki, stari od 45 do 54 let. Najstarejši pijani povzročitelj tragične nesreče je bil letos star 72 let (lani 84), najmlajši pa le 15 let (lani 21). Oba sta bila pešca. Največ tragičnih nesreč so sicer povzročili pijani vozniki osebnih avtomobilov. Po številu prometnih nesreč, povezanih z alkoholom, izstopata obalno kraška in pomurska statistična regija.
28ljudi je letos umrlo v nesrečah, ki so jih povzročili pijani vozniki ali drugi udeleženci v prometu
Ministrstvo za zdravje, policija, agencija za varnost prometa, inšpekcijske službe in nevladne organizacije, ob medijski podpori Vala 202, tudi letos opozarjajo na nevarnost vožnje pod vplivom alkohola in psihoaktivnih snovi. Veliko nesreč, ki jih povzročijo pijani vozniki, se zgodi prav med prazniki, zato bodo policisti novembra in decembra v okviru akcije Slovenija piha 0,0 preverjali, v kakšnem psihofizičnem stanju vozijo po slovenskih cestah. Kršitelje čaka kazen, vzorne voznike pa bodo nagradili. Dobili bodo letake, s katerimi si bodo lahko prislužili vstopnice za koncert policijskega orkestra. Na januarskem koncertu bosta s policijskimi glasbeniki nastopila Tomislav Jovanović Tokac in Neisha.
V tednu pred martinovanji, ko bodo po vsej Sloveniji številna praznovanja, bodo policisti in drugi sodelujoči aktivni predvsem v bližini gostinskih lokalov, zabaviščnih prostorov in v krajih, kjer se zadržuje večje število ljudi.
Tudi agencija za varnost prometa med akcijo pripravlja številne aktivnosti na terenu v sodelovanju z občinskimi sveti za preventivo in vzgojo v cestnem prometu in z nevladnimi organizacijami. Razdelili bodo 1500 plakatov ter 20.000 zloženk. Agencija je občinskim svetom za preventivo in vzgojo v cestnem prometu zagotovila tudi 3000 alkotestov za enkratno uporabo, ki jih bodo razdeljevali obiskovalcem v okviru terenskih akcij po lokalih in restavracijah. O vožnji brez alkohola bodo osveščali tudi predstavniki nevladnih organizacij, kot sta AMZS in Zavod Varna pot.
Za varnost smo odgovorni vsi
Na policiji opozarjajo, da smo za prometno varnost odgovorni prav vsi udeleženci v prometu. “Če ste uživali alkohol, ne sedite za volan, temveč naj vozi kdo, ki alkohola ni užival, ali pa uporabite javni prevoz,” svetujejo policisti. Z akcijo želijo znova opozoriti, da alkohol, droge ali druge psihoaktivne snovi močno vplivajo na psihofizične sposobnosti voznikov. “Javnost želimo s skupno akcijo spodbuditi k ničelni toleranci do uporabe teh snovi, ki imajo v prometu lahko usodne posledice,” pa dodajajo na agenciji za varnost prometa.

Drivers will be blowing before the martinis
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Sijan Pretnar

In the week before the marches, police officers are already on the roads, with Slovenia starting to blow 0.0. It will run until November 10 and then continue through December. During this time, police officers will tightly check the psychophysical abilities of drivers.



Yesterday, the preventive action Slovenia was blowing 0.0. Photo by Ana Cukijati

LJUBLJANA> By the last days of October, 1203 accidents had occurred on Slovene roads, caused by drunk drivers or other participants, which is 0.75 percent less than a year earlier. Drunken drivers have caused 28 people to die by the end of October, which is 47 percent more than in the same period last year when 19 people died. Of the 28 people who died in the crash, 18 also caused an accident.
The coastal Karst region stands out for alcohol related accidents
The most fatal accidents were caused by drivers aged 45-54. The oldest drunk driver of the tragic accident was 72 years old this year (84 last year) and the youngest only 15 years old (21 last year). They were both pedestrians. The most tragic accidents were caused by drunk drivers of passenger cars. In terms of the number of alcohol-related traffic accidents, the coastal Karst and Pomurje statistical regions stand out.
28 people died this year in accidents caused by drunk drivers or other road users
The Ministry of Health, the Police, the Transport Safety Agency, inspection services and non-governmental organizations, with media support from Vala 202, also this year point to the dangers of driving under the influence of alcohol and psychoactive substances. Many accidents caused by drunk drivers happen just during the holidays, so police officers in November and December will be checking 0.0 as a result of the campaign Slovenia, in which psycho-physical condition they are driving on Slovenian roads. The offenders are facing a fine and exemplary drivers will be rewarded. They will be given leaflets to earn tickets for a concert by the police orchestra. Tomislav Jovanovic Tokac and Neisha will perform with police musicians at a January concert.
In the week before the celebrations, when there will be numerous celebrations all over Slovenia, police officers and other participants will be active mainly in the vicinity of restaurants, entertainment venues and places where more people are staying.
During the campaign, the Agency for Traffic Safety also prepares a number of activities in the field in cooperation with the municipal councils for prevention and education in road transport and with non-governmental organizations. They will distribute 1500 posters and 20.000 leaflets. The agency has also provided 3,000 single-use breathalyzes to the municipal road safety councils, which will be distributed to visitors as part of field campaigns at bars and restaurants. Driving without alcohol will also be brought to the attention of representatives of non-governmental organizations such as AMZS and Zavod Varna pot.
We are all responsible for safety
Police warn that all road users are responsible for road safety. "If you have consumed alcohol, do not sit behind the wheel but drive by someone who has not consumed alcohol or use public transportation," police advised. The campaign seeks to reiterate that alcohol, drugs or other psychoactive substances have a profound effect on the psychophysical abilities of drivers. "We want to encourage the public, through a joint campaign, to zero tolerance for the use of these substances, which can have fatal consequences in traffic," they added at a traffic safety agency.
